item.title: Itt: royalists only!
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

What palaces does she “have”? I can’t think of any that she could actually sell or take the profits from, which makes it a bit disingenuous to say she “has” them for the purposes of figuring out what she’s worth…

Did you mean to link the response to that video btw, cuz thats the pro royal one (They’re both pretty inaccurate and silly in their own way though)

Read full topic

item.title: Itt: royalists only!
item.dc:creator: @Taios Taios
item.description:
@Taios wrote:

[quote=“Newty, post:40, topic:393058”][quote author=Taios link=topic=490229.msg3586349#msg3586349 date=1304209233]

I think what people are getting at is that the royals don’t work 9 to 5 jobs like Joe Citizen, but instead live off a handful of tax money paid by Joe Citizen.

This may not apply to the princes directly, but I’m sure it applies to the queen.

They don’t need to live off tax-payers money.
The interest alone on the Queens fortune pays for everything she needs and fair more. I believe worth is something like 17 Billion. She makes more in a day on interest then i’ll probably ever make for the rest of my life.
[/quote]

http://www.associatedcontent.com/article/5625082/how_much_is_queen_elizabeth_worth.html?cat=3[/quote]

Forbes doesnt take into account many other resources she has. Palace’s etc.

Either way:

Read full topic

item.title: Itt: royalists only!
item.dc:creator: @goatee goatee
item.description:
@goatee wrote:

I really liked how this wedding boosted the “community spirit”, I was at work while it was happening and this old lady and her son came in with pictures of Kate and her dress and the ceremony because she knew we couldn’t watch it. The pictures were just of the TV paused so were pretty low quality, and she had obviously asked her son to help her take/print them which I thought was pretty sweet. Was really nice to see someone give a shit about someone else like that so I gave her a free sandwich and coffee. Just made me a bit prouder of people in general.

Read full topic

item.title: Itt: royalists only!
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

I don’t like monarchy, but I see little point in getting rid of it in our country. It is different for others, but we’ll be no more free, we’ll be no more richer and we’ll be getting rid of a part of culture, that hasn’t always been good, and has in various occasions completely awful, but it has developed into something that has merged to become a part of the country, not something that is above or rules the country.

I don’t think many people do like the idea of a monarchy, even those that will come out in support of the British monarchy, they have tried their hardest to adapt to us, to ensure that we do continue to not just tolerate them, but see value in what having them around provides.

Read full topic

item.title: Itt: royalists only!
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

Article is slightly inaccurate since it says that she pays for the upkeep of Buckingham Palace. I believe at least a large portion of the upkeep of the palace (and other publicly used buildings) are paid for by the government. Unless that money is rolled into her salary? But I’m pretty sure it isn’t.
